meanings.definition: A condition in which the refractive power of the two eyes differs significantly.
meanings.sent1: Anisometropias can cause one eye to see things differently than the other.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist diagnosed the patient with anisometropias after noticing the unequal refractive errors.
meanings.sent3: The anisometropias in his eyes made him look like he was wearing two different pairs of glasses.
meanings.sent4: Her anisometropias created a unique perspective on the world, like seeing through two different lenses.
meanings.sent5: The anisometropias in her vision were like having two cameras with different focus settings.

meanings.definition: The presence of unequal refractive errors in the two eyes.
meanings.sent1: The anisometropias in her eyes required different prescriptions for each eye.
meanings.sent2: An optician can correct anisometropias by providing customized lenses for each eye.
meanings.sent3: His anisometropias were so extreme that he needed separate glasses for reading and distance vision.
meanings.sent4: The anisometropias in his eyes were like having mismatched binoculars, causing visual confusion.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with anisometropias is like trying to balance two different weights on a scale.
